de.dfki.oms.webapp

Class OMSOMMHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.dfki.oms.webapp.OMSOMMHandler

  • public class OMSOMMHandler
extends java.lang.Object
    A handler for operations on the OMS issued via HTTP requests.

      • handleDelete

        public static void handleDelete(javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request,
                                javax.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response)

        Handles a DELETE request.

        Deletes the resource given in the request if it is in the storage.

        Parameters:
        request - The HttpServletRequest sent to the handler.
        response - The HttpServletResponse sent back from the handler.

      • cloneMemory

        public static boolean cloneMemory(java.lang.String memoryName,
                                  java.io.File currentFile,
                                  de.dfki.omm.types.OMMEntity entity,
                                  java.lang.String remoteURL,
                                  de.dfki.omm.interfaces.OMMHeader header,
                                  de.dfki.omm.interfaces.OMMBlock ownerBlock,
                                  java.util.ArrayList<de.dfki.omm.interfaces.OMMBlock> blocks)
        Clones a given memory on the OMS.
        Parameters:
        memoryName - Name of the memory.
        currentFile - Path to the memory.
        entity - The OMMEntity creating the memory.
        remoteURL - URL to the memory's remote location.
        header - An OMMSecurityHeader describing the new memory.
        ownerBlock - An OMMBlock of the new memory.
        blocks - An ArrayList<OMMBlock> containing all the memory's blocks.
        Returns:
        True, if the creation was successful.

      • createNewMemory

        public static boolean createNewMemory(java.lang.String memoryName,

        Creates a new memory on the OMS.
        Parameters:
        memoryName - Name of the memory.
        currentFile - Path to the memory.
        entity - The OMMEntity creating the memory.
        remoteURL - URL to the memory's remote location.
        header - An OMMSecurityHeader describing the new memory.
        ownerBlock - An OMMBlock of the new memory.
        Returns:
        True, if the creation was successful.
